TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed AppSettingsSection extends System.Configuration.ConfigurationSection
Public NotInheritable Class AppSettingsSection Inherits ConfigurationSection

Docs.summary: Provides configuration system support for the configuration section. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `appSettings` configuration section provides for key/value pairs of `string` values for an application. Rather than accessing these values by using an instance of an <xref:System.Configuration.AppSettingsSection> object, you should use the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationManager.AppSettings%2A> property of the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationManager> class or the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.WebConfigurationManager.AppSettings%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.WebConfigurationManager> class.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.Configuration.AppSettingsSection> class in a console application. It reads and writes the key/value pairs that are contained by the `appSettings` section. It also shows how to access the <xref:System.Configuration.AppSettingsSection.File%2A> property of the <xref:System.Configuration.AppSettingsSection> class.
> [!NOTE] > Before you compile this code, add a reference in your project to System.Configuration.dll.
[!code-csharp[System.Configuration.AppSettingsSection#21](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.AppSettingsSection/CS/UsingAppSettingsSection.cs#21)] [!code-vb[System.Configuration.AppSettingsSection#21](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.AppSettingsSection/VB/AppSettingsSection.vb#21)] [!code-vb[System.Configuration.AppSettingsSection#21](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.AppSettingsSection/VB/UsingAppSettingsSection.vb#21)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a configuration file that provides additional settings or overrides the settings specified in the element.
Docs.value: A configuration file that provides additional settings or overrides the settings specified in the element.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example stores additional `appSettings` values in an external configuration file and saves the name of this file in the <xref:System.Configuration.AppSettingsSection.File%2A> property.
[!code-csharp[System.Configuration.AppSettingsSection#22](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.AppSettingsSection/CS/UsingAppSettingsSection.cs#22)] [!code-vb[System.Configuration.AppSettingsSection#22](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.AppSettingsSection/VB/AppSettingsSection.vb#22)] [!code-vb[System.Configuration.AppSettingsSection#22](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Configuration.AppSettingsSection/VB/UsingAppSettingsSection.vb#22)]

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of key/value pairs that contains application settings.
Docs.value: A collection of key/value pairs that contains the application settings from the configuration file.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example uses the <xref:System.Configuration.AppSettingsSection.Settings%2A> property to read the `appSettings` values.
